I am applying because:

* I'd like to be more involved in the day-to-day development of Ubuntu (transitions, merges etc.)
** The changes required to fix a package for a transition are often fairly small, so sponsorship can easily cause twice as much effort for each fix
* I want to become a core dev

=== Who I Am ===

I have been using GNU/Linux systems since the early 00s; my initial experience was with Red Hat and Fedora, before becoming a Debian user circa 2006.  Since then, I have run Debian or Ubuntu on pretty much all of my systems, professionally or personally.

On graduating from the University of Warwick in 2010, I worked for a Debian-focussed free software consultancy named credativ.  In this role, I was involved in maintaining a number of Debian servers for clients, as well as developing and packaging solutions for a variety of problems. After that, I moved to London where I developed Django web applications with several startups, honing my Python skills.

In September 2014, I joined Canonicalâ€™s Certified Public Cloud team, where I work to make Ubuntu the best it can be in the cloud. In practical terms, this consists of debugging issues, writing tooling for testing and publication, and packaging changes needed for the various clouds in to Ubuntu.

The CPC team was merged in to the Ubuntu Foundations team in FIXME, bringing me closer to the day-to-day development of the distro.
